clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of the Effects of Sedentary Behaviour and Moderate Exercise on Glucose Tolerance and Insulin Sensitivity
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of the Effects of Sedentary Behaviour and Moderate Exercise on Glucose Tolerance and Insulin Sensitivity

brief_summary.textblock:
Individuals with pre-diabetes or diabetes would benefit from low impact methods that would improve their insulin sensitivity and aid in maintaining glucose homeostasis. Physical activity helps the body decrease its insulin resistance and burn excess sugar. Many diabetics also suffer from obesity and specific forms or durations of physical exercise may not be viable options for these individuals. Determining whether short bursts of moderate exercise improve blood glucose levels in healthy humans may identify a further method for diabetics to improve their glucose homeostasis.
The aim of this study is to determine the most effective moderate exercise that can be completed in 3 minutes and its effectiveness on improving glucose handling, in response to a single day of standardized high-fat and high-carbohydrate feeding in comparison to periods of prolonged sitting.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-prandial baseline (12 hours fasted) and 3 hours post-prandial on each of two testing days
primary_outcome.description: The change in blood insulin levels from baseline (12 hours fasted) to 3-hours post-prandial will be determined from blood serum using a human metabolic hormone multiplex panel (Luminex xMAP technology).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-prandial baseline (12 hours fasted) and 3 hours post-prandial on each of two testing days
primary_outcome.description: The change in blood C-peptide levels from baseline (12 hours fasted) to 3-hours post-prandial will be determined from blood serum using a human metabolic hormone multiplex panel (Luminex xMAP technology).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and every 30-60 minutes over 3 hours (6 timepoints per test day)
primary_outcome.description: Blood glucose levels will be determined at pre-prandial baseline and over the following 3-hour testing period using hand-held blood glucose meters.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in metabolomic response to a test meal
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-prandial and 3-hours post test meal through study completion
primary_outcome.description: Targeted metabolomics analysis of approximately 139 metabolites in blood serum by LC-MS/MS to generate a metabolomic profile in response to a high-fat and high-carbohydrate test meal. Metabolites to be determined are categorized as biogenic amines, amino acids, histidines, carboxylic acids, acylcarnitines, glycerophospholipids and organic acids.

secondary_outcome.measure: Immediate effects of short-term sedentary behaviour on cognitive function
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 hours post-activity (sedentary behaviour or exercise) on test days through study completion
secondary_outcome.description: Assessing cognitive abilities using the Stroop Test.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 hours post-activity (sedentary behaviour or exercise) on test days through study completion
secondary_outcome.description: Assessing cognitive abilities using the Iowa Trail Making Test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Immediate effects of short-term sedentary behaviour on cognitive function
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 hours post-activity (sedentary behaviour or exercise) on test days through study completion
secondary_outcome.description: Assessing cognitive abilities using the Digit-Span test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Immediate effects of short-term sedentary behaviour on cognitive function
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 hours post-activity (sedentary behaviour or exercise) on test days through study completion
secondary_outcome.description: Assessing cognitive abilities using the N-back test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Immediate effects of short-term sedentary behaviour on cognitive function
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 hours post-activity (sedentary behaviour or exercise) on test days through study completion
secondary_outcome.description: Assessing cognitive abilities using the Flankers test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Gene expression levels in isolated PBMC populations
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-prandial and 3 hours post-prandial on on test days through study completion
secondary_outcome.description: Determining changes in gene expression in pathways associated with RAGE signalling.

arm_group.description: No intervention. Study participants will be seated during the entire sedentary 3-hour time period and wheeled to phlebotomy (and exercise) stations when required. During the sedentary period, participants will eat the food according to the study protocol and be seated at desks and allowed to read and use computers.
Will disrupt their sedentary time with 3 minute exercise sessions every 30 minutes

intervention.description: 3-hour sedentary period with 3 minute activity breaks of moderate exercise every 30 minutes
